text: I am the old sage in this frame, and I have a quiet lesson for you.
In my youth I chased grand answers and forgot the power of small, steady steps.
Then I learned: progress hides in repetition, not leaps.
One morning I placed a single pebble on the road and walked past it again and again.
I did not rush; I kept showing up, day after day.
Before long, the path appearedâ€”not by leaps, but by consistent steps.
So pick one tiny habit you can do today.
Tell me in the comments: what is your one small step?
